node.statement: (Skorokhod coupling and a.s. convergence of Psi_eps^{ren}) By the construction of the Phi^4_3 measure (Hairer 2014, Gubinelli-Hofmanova 2019), the regularized measures mu_eps converge weakly to mu on the enhanced data space X := C^{-1/2-delta}(T^3) x C^{-1-delta}(T^3) x C^{-3/2-delta}(T^3), which is a Polish space. By the Skorokhod representation theorem (Billingsley, Convergence of Probability Measures, Theorem 6.7), there exist a probability space (Omega, F, P) and X-valued random variables Phi_eps, Phi on Omega with law(Phi_eps) = mu_eps, law(Phi) = mu, and Phi_eps -> Phi P-a.s. in X. This is the same coupling as in node 1.6.2.10.3 (validated). In particular, for every f in C^inf(T^3) and k in {1,2,3}, the duality pairing <f, :phi_eps^k:> is a continuous functional on X (by the Besov duality pairing C^{k/2+2delta} x C^{-k/2-delta} -> R, with strict regularity gap k/2+2delta > k/2+delta, cf. node 1.6.1 validated), so <f, :Phi_eps^k:> -> <f, :Phi^k:> P-a.s. CONSEQUENCE FOR Psi^{ren}: The renormalized exponent Psi_eps^{ren}(phi) = 4 lambda int psi :phi^3: dx - 6 lambda int psi^2 :phi^2: dx + 4 lambda <psi^3, phi> + <(-Delta+m^2)psi, phi> (node 1.5.1) is a finite sum of continuous functionals of the enhanced data. Therefore Psi_eps^{ren}(Phi_eps) -> Psi^{ren}(Phi) P-a.s. Since exp is continuous, exp(Psi_eps^{ren}(Phi_eps)) -> exp(Psi^{ren}(Phi)) P-a.s. DEPENDENCIES: Nodes 1.6.2.10.3, 1.6.1, 1.5.1, 1.5.3.
